text:
VFX studios in London can vary in work ethic and can have a different completely different working atmospheres.
I’ve been lucky that the companies I worked for have had a friendly relaxed atmosphere, and a great social scene.  The company I work for now isn’t huge and we encourage artists NOT to work late. 
In a creative industry you’ll generally find a pleasant working atmosphere compared to other jobs. But there’s always exceptions unfortunately. I worked in a company that made commercials and the work culture was fast paced and stressful.
You’ll be surprised as to how many people you’ll meet in animation with a similar outlook on life.

Good to hear not all companies treat their staff like cheap confetti (although ironically for me I hear American companies are known for that). Would you say its easy or at least easier to make friends with work colleagues in animation? I generally find it difficult and hold hope that it'll be easier in the work environment I want to be in since animation is something I love so much
